meanings.definition: A mark of credit granted to a student who is unable to complete an examination due to illness.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave out aegrotats to the sick students who couldn't finish the test.
meanings.sent2: Receiving an aegrotats can help students who fall ill during exams.
meanings.sent3: The aegrotats were like a golden ticket for the unwell students.
meanings.sent4: The aegrotats acted as a shield against the impact of illness on grades.
meanings.sent5: The aegrotats were a lifeline for students facing unexpected health challenges.
